its good but you have to want to play this kind of puzzle game i just end up accidentally speedrunning losing all my guys in the first 3 seconds literally some really dated menu and option systems i dont even know if you can change parameters for the quick skirmishes theres a story campaign and the writing actually seems really interesting but im not good enough at the game to experience it

for 6 its a fine enough game i think it has a few hours worth of enjoyment to it unfortunately the micromanagement becomes tedious quickly might be fun enough i got it on sale quite a while ago for 12 though its not worth it

this is a game that pc gamer recommended so i thought id give it a go  you have to do a lot of thinking and planning giving orders to your squad ahead of time trying to anticipate what moves your opponent might make a little like chess  if you like this turnbased style of play then youll enjoy it  on the other hand if you prefer to rely on lightningfast reflexes then this probably isnt the game for you
while fun the game crashes several times per hour

easy to learn difficult to master its a nittygritty technical game and its a shame it doesnt have a slightly more dynamic gamemode but its good for what it is its priced accordingly and its a breath of fresh air in the worldbuilding and visual design
i bought this to support the dev bc i like his music

great play even just with the skirmish generator
fun game
its not bad at all i had some fun with it
great
fun tactical ease of play strategic if you like smart games this is for you

one of the great best to do it

better than chess
had this game for years forgot my password and the dev reset it very quickly

always loved the elegant simplicity of the play  looks simple but endless possibilities with the variety of map layouts and characters  after thousands of plays a win is never a sure thing even vs a novice  ive been to 1 global at least 3 times but my policy of playing every single game no matter how unfavorable a spawn keeps me humble  beautiful game
yes
strategy rts with some turnbased elements really fun campaign gets extremely challenging and has multiplayer options a fun little pickmeup type of game
the og you may recall seeing games like this in your app store this is basically that but better  very strategic game slow and steady is the way to play this  7510

battle chess is a great name for this it combines the tactical methodical planning of rainbow six with the unit movement of a smallscale real time strategy this game is easy to approach and difficult to master but ill tell you it kept my roommates and i enamored for months not to mention the asynchronous multiplayer is a brilliant mechanic that makes you excited to open it up and see how your games are going
ok it may be old and noone is playing it and the controls are clunky but i like it
i loved playing this game with friends but sadly i had a tough time convincing more people to buy it so we could play together the tacticalstrategy element is a lot of fun
excellent tactical game
a fun but challenging turn based game where the turns happen at the same time as it should great for multiplayer
played this when it came out need to try it again

single player is way too luckbased i was expecting puzzles but the campaign levels have randomised starting layouts and the ai acts unpredictable  only buy if you have friends to do the multiplayer with
great strategic game  tactical and intense
interesting game pretty cool stuff i plan to play more ill give a more detailed review when i do but running the tutorial and some of the early game i was having fun
good game   controls and ui are somewhat dated by todays standards and the game is much more freeform than i remembered but it still is a fun tactical game to play all around
yes
good tactics game

fantastic game the strategy and tactics are amazing the only problem i have with it is that sometimes terrain doesnt update and my units walk strangely its also not very informative as to what does and doesnt contribute to winning an engagement
a predictive strategy game where you strategize based on what you think the enemys next moves will be cool concept that actually works in the gameplay
wanted to like this game for the interesting mechanics and themes but just couldnt get into it

a scifi version of chess plan your moves find out the moves of your opponent adapt and overcome lengthy campaign and versus modes will allow you to play this one for a while even if its quite old and the community is not what it was on release
at your pace strategy is great
very good game
great game pure tactical gameplay with no bloat
nice turnbased strategy
i like this game due to the basic sand out graphics and the turn by turn game play i like placing my pieces to win the game
crashes more often than not a fun game but it doesnt work dont waste your money
still outstanding
greatest game ever
good strategy title with asynchronous play but simultaneous turns
quick fun skirmishes which can be played async be sure to grab a friend

for some reason people who have never seen a turnbased rpg are in awe at this dont be fooled theres very little strategic depth here youre too dependent on guesswork and favorable rng rolls to succeed and the randomized level geometry and unit placement means its usually in your favor to just restart each mission until you get a favorable map its a fine idea with pretty lackluster execution
yes

steep initial learning curve but if you stay with it past the first few hours it gets pretty great  good tactics gameplay level randomization keeps things interesting learning the mechanics brings things to a new level
very difficult strategy game yes
interesting little strategy game
awesome tactics game really unique and deep gameplay from simple elements
looks more fun that it actually is
best squad tactics game there is
an excellent experiment in turnbased doubleblind tactical planning the units and programming arent as complex as the sequel but the carefully designed levels and story make it the superior game
wowee

this is top shelf squadbased tactical combat if you like that sort of thing you will probably like this the system where you predict how moves will play out and then watch them actually play them out in real time adds some great tension to the genre
does not scale properly for all laptops  customer support nonexistent 2020ad  the game itself is ok when working ill give it 75 scale 410 on light strategy category
utterly fantastically brilliant

its fun its a good turn base with friends or frenemies but the tutorial is trash and frustrating as hell because it disables certain controls and locks itself up once you get through it dont forget how to play
this game is unfriendly to the player and multiplayer is pretty much dead
fun and challenging tactical turn based game takes a while to figure out how to get the most of each type of unit

awesome topdown tactics strategy game which plays out 5 seconds at a time it suits many gaming styles as you can play with as much or as little detail in your commands as you want if you prefer the former then it can be quite timeconsuming entering your moves but you speed up once you play a bit the multiplayer is also great though i prefer playing against friends over randoms great soundtrack too
insane micromanagement horrible controls and bad multiplayer this tactical game just makes you mad
loading times kinda suck

very fun if you like turnbased squad shooting games it plays a little like xcom but overhead 100 of the time with wireframe characters it uses procedurally generated random level designs each time you load a level so if youre losing you can restart there are other similar games around but this one is small efficient concentrates on gameplay there is a weird futurist story too though its all in text

exceptional strategy game has just the right balance of command complexity unit types and level design doesnt suffer from the overly complicated weapons and unit systems that many other tactical games have less is more here

best game
enjoyable turn based combat
amazing
i was in the beta for this and loved it i havent played in years but there are plenty of happy memories  the plot and dialogue are both really good too a refreshing change

what a great game
quick fun thats also challenging

this was a good game but sadly a lot of people forgot or canceled their games on me have not bought 2 but am interested
synchronous turnbased strategy you can play by correspondence several classes of characters that complement each other the idea is great but not addictive the game is very amateur

the best way i can describe this game is that you are an ai controlling robots the game is turnbased but during your turn your able to preform simulations to see what would happen if you moved somewhere while the enemy sees you or who would fire the first shot the game requires patience and careful planning and i find it to be a ton of fun now all i need to do is learn to be more patient

this game is pure turn based strategy at its finest it takes me back to some of the great tactics games from the late 90s   its got a relatively simple introduction but delivers constant permutations on that initial premise that keeps it challenging well designed levels good difficulty curve 1010 would blow my entire team up with my own rockets again and again
hotseat online multiplayer but no lan
the mechanism behind who shoots who is too fuzzy to plan for

fun innovative and engaging gameplay though it does go stale in longer sessions due to the limited scope of it good to play for maybe 30min to an hour at a time   probably dont bother with the campaign the writing is some of the most 13 year old stuff ive ever read

its a very slow game in so far that every turn you make takes over an hour easily if you plan it out entirely that said the ability to get into the nitty gritty and finding your worst case scenario not play out and giving advantage makes it very enjoyable
underrated and underappreciated classic
shite
very good strategypuzzle game would recommend if you like chess turnbased combat sims or xcom

frozen synapse has one of the best turn based dynamics in a game ever the preplanning phase where you create complex commands for your troops which then transitions into both players turns happening simultaneously leads to some really intense decision making  it also leads to some hilarious mistakes and funny moments when you have no idea what youre doing

i finished this game long ago near to her release date and this was enjoyable this game have a lot of interesting timeconnected features which i never met before so right know i was glad to spend some time here but i cant forget maps and this ruined my second experience though levels have randomly genereted furniture on the map anyway recommended

this is another hidden gem if you appreciate turn based tactics   the game is well designed and easy to learn challenging enough to create a great coop experience i have not exerienced pvp but i imagine that would be a good time the simple design really shines here   this is a great way to kill a few minutes here and there  the dev could do well by releasing a level editor that would bring a lot of life to this great game
fun and strategic game to play with friends interesting game mechanics easy to learn hard master
